articles.title: Ecuador deports hundreds of Colombian inmates as Bogota cries foul
articles.content: Ecuadoran authorities said Saturday they had deported hundreds of Colombian prisoners via a land border crossing, after Bogota protested that the move came without prior agreement. In 2024, Ecuadoran President Daniel Noboa announced his intention to deport Colombian inmates to ease overcrowding in the country's prisons. Small groups were transferred starting in April. But Colombian President Gustavo Petro opposed the move, saying that a joint plan was needed to safeguard the prisoners' rights. Governor Diana Pozo had previously told reporters that 800 prisoners had been transported through the crossing.
